Package mmj.lang

Class Formula

java.lang.Object
mmj.lang.Formula
public class Formula extends Object
Formula is, basically just an array of Sym, with a counter.

Sub-Classes of Formula exist: VarHypFormula and LogicFormula but their function is basically just to simplify certain coding in VarHyp, LogHyp, etc. In theory, the distinction would be useful for creating default exprRPN's.

Formula: contains Cnst in sym[0], followed by the formula's "expression", which consists of zero or more Cnst's and Var's in sym[1]...sym[cnt - 1].

Formula Factoids:

  • A formula must have length >= 1.
  • sym[0], the first Sym in a Formula must be a Cnst.
  • sym[0] is the Type Code of the Formula, and by extension, the Stmt's Type Code.
  • sym[1] through sym[sym.length - 1] are referred to in mmj as the Formula's "Expression" -- which is simply the Formula minus its Type Code.
  • Every Stmt has a Formula, but a Formula can be created without a corresponding Stmt (which is the reason Formula was made into a class.)
See Also:
  • Nomenclature and Entity-Relationship Notes

    • Formula

      public Formula(Map<String,Sym> symTbl, String typS, List<String> symList, List<Hyp> hypList) throws LangException
      Construct using String Type Code and Sym List.

      Verifies that each Sym id in Expression is active and accumulates the matching VarHyp's in the input exprHypList param.

      1. verify that each symbol string in an expression is defined and active, and that each referenced variable is defined by an active variable hypothesis (in scope). NOTE: this routine is not used for disjoint variables because they do not have "expressions" as such, and also, they may not have active variable hypotheses.
      2. build a Sym[] as the symbol strings are scanned, thus converting the source strings to unique object references.
      3. while building Sym[], build the set of variable hypotheses for the variables in the expression, and store them in the input hypList.
      Parameters:
      symTbl - Map containing Cnst and Var definitions.
      typS - Formula Type Code String.
      symList - expression's symbol character strings
      hypList - List of Hyp's. Is updated with unique variable hypotheses in the expression. Because the list is maintained in database statement sequence order, hypList should either be empty (new) before the call, or already be in that order (see accumHypInList.
      Throws:
      LangException - if duplicate symbol, etc. (see mmj.lang.LangConstants.java)

      public static Formula constructTempDummyFormula(Cnst typ, String dummySym) throws LangException
      Construct a temporary dummy Formula for transient use. This is useful in ProofWorksheet.
      Parameters:

      dummySym - a string of characters that should not have non-printable characters or whitespace (else renderFormula may come out wrong!)
      Returns:
      the dummy Formula
      Throws:
      LangException - if dummySym is empty

    • getParseNodeHolderExpr

      public ParseNodeHolder[] getParseNodeHolderExpr(VarHyp[] varHypArray)
      Builds a "custom" version of an Expression in which an array of ParseNodeHolders is output for use in generating a ParseTree.

      The key fact about the output ParseNodeHolders is that a Cnst in the Formula Expression just goes into the holder's "mObj" -- it will not be part of the ParseTree and the ParseNode element is null.

      On the other hand, Variables in the Formula's Expression are converted into ParseNodes with Stmt = the VarHyp; the ParseNodeHolder's "mObj" element is set to the VarHyp Stmt reference -- and this ParseNode will be part of the ultimate Parse Tree. In effect, we're "parsing" VarHyps and creating their output ParseNodes at this time.)

      Parameters:
      varHypArray - Array of VarHyp for Formula.
      Returns:
      ParseNodeHolder array.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if unable to find a VarHyp for one of the Formula's Var's.

    • getParseNodeHolderExpr

      public ParseNodeHolder[] getParseNodeHolderExpr(Hyp[] hypArray)
      Builds a "custom" version of an Expression in which an array of ParseNodeHolders is output for use in generating a ParseTree.
      Parameters:
      hypArray - Array of Hyp for Formula.
      Returns:
      ParseNodeHolder array.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if unable to find a VarHyp for one of the Formula's Var's.

    • buildRuleFormatExpr

      public Cnst[] buildRuleFormatExpr(VarHyp[] varHypArray)
      Builds a "rule format" version of the Formula's Expression. Each Cnst in the Expression is output unchanged, while the Type Code (a Cnst) of each Var is output instead of the var -- this requires looking up the Var's VarHyp in the input varHypArray. For example, Expression "( ph -> ps )" is output as "( wff -> wff )".
      Parameters:
      varHypArray - Array of VarHyp for Formula.
      Returns:
      ruleFormatExpr in an array of Cnst.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if unable to find a VarHyp for one of the Formula's Var's.

    • buildMandVarHypArray

      public VarHyp[] buildMandVarHypArray(Hyp[] tempHypArray)
      Uses an array of Hyps to build an array of VarHyps containing only the VarHyps needed for the variables actually used in the Formula.

      Note: if the input array of Hyps does not contain all of the necessary VarHyps, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown! No mercy.

      Parameters:
      tempHypArray - array of Hyp.
      Returns:
      ruleFormatExpr in an array of Cnst.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if unable to find a VarHyp for one of the Formula's Var's.

    • exprEquals

      public boolean exprEquals(Object obj)
      Compare Expression for equality with another Formula's expr (don't compare Type Codes, in other words).

      Equal if and only if the Sym strings are equal. and the obj to be compared to this object is not null and is a Formula as well.

      Parameters:
      obj - Formula whose Expression will be compared to this Formula's Expression.
      Returns:
      returns true if equal, otherwise false.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Computes a character string version of Formula for printing.

      Note: LogicalSystem does not validate for "printable" characters in Sym, and output of certain non-printable characters can cause abrupt termination of DOS windows (though mmj.mmio does extensive validation, LogicalSystem itself is unconcerned about the contents of Sym id strings.)

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      String for the Formula

    • exprToString

      public String exprToString()
      Computes a character string version of the expression portion of the formula.

      Note: the "expression" here is the 2nd thru nth symbols of the formula -- that is, the type code at the start is discarded.

      Returns:
      String for the expression portion of Formula

    • toProofWorksheetStringBuilder

      public int toProofWorksheetStringBuilder(StringBuilder sb, int leftColContinuation, int marginRight)
      Formats formula symbol strings into a column of characters within a text area. Weird because it does not indent on the first line, but the output can be simply "append"ed to the text area, which presumably already has data to the left of "leftColContinuation" on line 1. the first line of text -- to
      Parameters:
      sb - StringBuilder to append to.
      leftColContinuation - the leftmost column in the text area for use by formulas.
      marginRight - the rightmost column for use by formulas.
      Returns:
      nbrLines used by the output formula.

    • accumHypInList

      public static <T extends Hyp> void accumHypInList(List<T> hypList, T hypNew)
      Accumulate unique hypotheses (no duplicates), storing them in an array list in order of their appearance in the database.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the actual type of the list
      Parameters:
      hypList - -- List of Hyp's. Is updated with unique variable hypotheses in the expression. Because the list is maintained in database statement sequence order, hypList should either be empty (new) before the call, or already be in that order (see accumHypInList.
      hypNew - candidate Hyp to be added to hypList if not already there.

    • computeWidthOfWidestExprCnst

      public int computeWidthOfWidestExprCnst()
      Computes the width in characters of the widest Cnst in the Formula's Expression.
      Returns:
      width in characters of the widest Cnst in the Formula's Expression -- or -1 if the Expression is null or if it contains no constants.
